metadata.document_name: 27. Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr v. Rishabh Bansal
metadata.source_pdf: 27. Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr v. Rishabh Bansal.pdf
metadata.court_name: HIGH COURT OF DELHI AT NEW DELHI
key_issues: Here are the main legal issues extracted from the document:
Registration of Pending Trademarks and Copyright Applications
Passing Off by Identical or Deceptively Similar Mark/Nomenclature
Act of Infringement by Trade Marks/Device SATKARMI/SAKARNI
Reproduction and Adaptation of Artistic Features without Permission
metadata.decision_summary:
**Case Summary:**

**C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 752/2022 & cont. matter vs. CS (Comm.) 48/2023 and I.A. 1627/2023**

The case involves a trademark infringement dispute between the plaintiffs, Ashok Kumar Gupta and another, and the defendant, Rishabh Bansal.

**Background:**
The dispute revolves around the use of the trademark/label "SAKARNI PLASTER/SAKARNI WALL GUARD/SAKARNI" by the plaintiff's against the defendant's use of a similar mark. The plaintiffs claimed that they were the original and registered proprietors of the trademerk/label, while the defendant admitted to using a deceptively similar mark.

**Legal Issues:**

1. Trademark infringement
2. Passing off
3. Copyright infringement

**Arguments:**

The plaintiff's argued that the defendant's use of the "SAKARNI" mark was an infringement of their registered trademark and would cause confusion among consumers. The plaintiffs also claimed copyright in the artistic features of the packaging pouches, labels, and scripts used for the product.

The defendant admitted to using the impugned mark but denied any intention to pass off or infringe on the plaintiff's rights.

**Court Findings:**

1. The Court acknowledged that the plaintiff's were the original and registered proprietors of the trademark/label "SAKARNI PLASTER/SAKARNI WALL GUARD/SAKARNI".
2. The defendant admitted to using a deceptively similar mark, which would lead to confusion among consumers.

**Decision:**

On 29th March 2023, the Court passed an oral judgment:

1. Settled Disputes:
	* "A"
	* "B"
2. Injunctions:
	* The defendant was restrained from using the trademerk/label "SAKARNI PLASTER/SAKARNI WALL GUARD/SAKARNI" in any manner whatsoever.
	* The defendant was also restrained from reproducing or adapting any artistic features of the plaintiff's packaging material, labels, and scripts used for the product.

**Settlement Agreement:**

The parties entered into a settlement agreement on 14th March 2023 under the Delhi High Court Mediation and Conciliation Centre. The terms of the settlement read:

a. Acknowledgment by the defendant of the plaintiff's proprietary rights in the trademark/label "SAKARNI PLASTER/SAKARNI WALL GUARD/SAKARNI".

b. Admittance by the defendant of the plaintiff's copyright in the artistic features of packaging pouches, labels including their distinctive scripts, fonts, positions and placing.

c. Admssion by the defendant that the plaintiffs were prior users of the trademark/label "SAKARNI PLASTER/SAKARNI WALL GUARD/SAKARNI".

d. Undertaking by the defendant to not commit any act of infringement or passing off.

e. Withholding of objection by the defendant to registration of pending trademarks and copyright applications.

f-h. Other undertakings by the defendant.

**Conclusion:**
The Court accepted the terms of settlement, considering it fair and reasonable. The judgment aims to prevent future disputes between the parties.

and/or combination of colours constituting infringement of

i.  
The Respondent no. 1/Defendant undertakes to this Hon'ble 
Court to recall all the marketing, promotional and advertising 
materials that bear or incorporate the mark “SATKARMI/ 
/SAKARNI” or any other mark similar to the 
Plaintiffs/Petitioners' "SAKARNI PLASTER/SAKARNI WALL 
GUARD/SAKARNI" mark, which have been distributed, sold or 
shipped before entering into the present settlement.

The Respondent no. 1/Defendant undertakes before this 
Hon'ble Court that he will destroy all the blocks, dies, screens, 
works, wrappers and any other material in which the impugned 
mark or infringing trade dress or copyright within fifteen days 
from the date of the order passed by this Hon'ble Court. 
 
k.  
The Respondent no. 1/Defendant further undertakes to this 
Hon'ble Court that he will not either directly or indirectly, or 
through any of its entity apply or encourage others directly or 
indirectly for the registration of any trade mark/trade name 
“SATKARMI/
/SAKARNI” or any word/mark deceptively 
similar to the trademark "SAKARNI PLASTER/SAKARNI 
WALL GUARD/SAKARNI" of the Plaintiffs/Petitioners. 
 
1.  
That the Respondent no. 1/Defendant has already paid a 
sum of Rs. 1,25,000/- by way of two transactions through UPI

plaintiffs towards token damages in the Bank Account of the

Industries receipt whereof duly acknowledged. 
 
m. 
The Respondent no. 1/Defendant further agrees to pay the 
plaintiffs/petitioners without any demur or protest a sum of INR 
25,00,000/- (Twenty Five Lakhs Only) in the event of the 
occurrence of any default/breach by them of any condition set forth

By:SUNIL SINGH NEGI

herein above provided that such breach/default arises out of the

Respondent no. 1/Defendant; 
 
n.  
The Respondent no. 1/Defendant has no objection if a 
decree of perpetual injunction is passed by this Hon'ble Court in 
favour of the plaintiffs according to the prayer clause of the 
paragraph 32 (a)&(b) of the plaint in CS (Comm.) No. 48 of 2023

herein and confirm and verify the same to be correct and that they

pressure, or undue influence from any quarter and both sides agree 
to abide by the terms and conditions herein. 
 
p.  
The Parties have gone through this present Settlement 
Agreement and have understood the same and have no objections 
to the present terms and conditions. The parties also understand 
that bleach of the terms and conditions of this Settlement 
Agreement shall invite lawful action for contempt of court against 
them by the other party in the concerned Court 
 
q.  
That the Parties undertake before the Hon'ble Court to 
abide by the terms and conditions set out in the agreement and not 
to dispute the same hereinafter in future. 
 
r.  
The parties agree that they shall appear before the Hon'ble 
court during the hearing to make their statements in terms of the 
present settlement agreement.” 
 
2. 
Learned Counsel are present on behalf of their respective 
parties.  They undertake to abide by the aforesaid terms of settlement. 
 
3. 
As such, nothing survives for adjudication in the suit as well as 
the rectification petition.  Rectification petition stands disposed of and 
the suit stands decreed in terms of the aforesaid Settlement Agreement 
executed between the parties to which they shall remain bound. 
 
4. 
Let a decree-sheet be drawn up by the Registry.  
 
5. 
The plaintiffs would be entitled to refund of court fee, if any, 
Digitally Signed
By:SUNIL SINGH NEGI
Signing Date:11.04.2023
15:25:22
Signature Not Verified

--- PAGE 5 ---
Neutral Citation Number : 2023:DHC:2449 
C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 752/2022 & cont. matter 
Page 5 of 5 
 
deposited by them. 
 
6. 
Miscellaneous applications do not survive for consideration and 
are disposed of accordingly. 
 
 
 
C.HARI SHANKAR, J 
MARCH 29, 2023

tree_structure.title: Case Header and Parties
tree_structure.summary:
Here is a summary of the case law document:

**Case Details**

* Case Name: Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr vs Rishabh Bansal
* Court: High Court of Delhi at New Delhi
* Neutral Citation Number: 2023:DHC:2449
* C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) No. 752/2022 and cont. matter

**Parties**

* Petitioners/Plaintiffs: Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr.
	+ Represented by Mr. Vishal Patel, Advocate
* Respondents/Defendants: Rishabh Bansal & Anr.
	+ Represented by Ms. Akanksha Singh, Advocate

**Settlement**

* The disputes between the parties were settled through a Settlement Agreement dated 14th March 2023 executed under the aegis of the Delhi High Court Mediation and Conciliation Centre.
* The terms of settlement include:
	+ Respondent No. 1/Defendant admits to certain claims made by the Petitioners/Plaintiffs.

**Judgment**

* Judgment (Oral) was delivered on 29th March 2023 by Hon'ble Mr. Justice C.Hari Shankar.
* The court noted that the Disputes stand settled as per the settlement agreement.

**Source**

* PDF: 27. Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr v. Rishabh Bansal.pdf

tree_structure.title: Facts and Arguments
tree_structure.summary:
**Case:** Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr v. Rishabh Bansal (2023:DHC:2449)

**Background:** A trademark dispute between Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr (plaintiffs/petitioners) and Rishabh Bansal & Anr (respondents/defendants).

**Plaintiffs' Claims:**

* Registered proprietors of the trademark "SAKARNI PLASTER" in Class 19.
* Prior users of the trademark.
* Owners of copyright in the artistic features of their packaging pouches, labels, and scripts.

**Defendant's Admissions:**

* Acknowledges plaintiffs' proprietary rights to the trademarks.
* Admits plaintiffs' prior use of the trademark "SAKARNI PLASTER".
* Agrees not to commit acts of infringement or passing off by using identical or similar marks.
* Undertakes to withdraw their application for registration of impugned mark/device SATKARMI.

**Court's Orders:**

* The parties reached a settlement agreement on November 4, 2022.
* The respondent undertook to recall all marketing and promotional materials and not make any further adaptations infringing Plaintiffs' copyrights.
* The parties agreed that the respondents will not file any applications for registration of marks similar or identical to plaintiffs' trademarks.

**Parties Involved:**

* Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr (Plaintiffs/Petitioners)
* Rishabh Bansal & Anr (Respondents/Defendants)

**Reference:** [PDF Source: Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr v. Rishabh Bansal (2023:DHC:2449)]
tree_structure.pdf_source: 27. Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr v. Rishabh Bansal.pdf

nodes.title: Page 2
nodes.summary:
Here is a summary of page 2 from the PDF "27. Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr v. Rishabh Bansal.pdf":

**Case Details:**

* Neutral Citation Number: 2023:DHC:2449
* C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 752/2022 & cont. matter
* CS (Comm.) No. 48 of 2023

**Respondent's Admission:**

The Respondent, Rishabh Bansal, admits to the following facts:

* The Plaintiffs/Petitioners are the original and registered proprietors of the trademark "SAKARNI PLASTER/SAKARNI WALL GUARD/SAKARNI".
* They acknowledge the Plaintiffs' proprietary right in the said trademarks.
* They recognize the Plaintiffs' copyright in the artistic features of the packaging pouches, labels, and packaging material.
* They admit to being a prior user of the trademark "SAKARNI PLASTER/SAKARNI WALL GUARD/SAKARNI".

**Undertakings by Respondent:**

The Respondent undertakes not to commit any act of infringement or passing off by using identical or deceptively similar trademarks, scripts, fonts, or packaging material.

nodes.title: Page 3
nodes.summary:
Page 3 of the PDF "Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr v. Rishabh Bansal" (2023:DHC:2449) contains terms of a settlement agreement between the parties.

Key points:

* Respondent No. 1/Defendant undertakes to withdraw the application for registration of the mark/device SATKARMI within two weeks.
* Respondent No. 1/Defendant guarantees not to file any future applications for trade marks similar or identical to the Plaintiffs/Petitioners' trademark "SAKARNI PLASTER/etc.".

The page also mentions the destruction of marketing materials and blocks, dies, screens, works, wrappers, etc., that bear the impugned mark within 15 days from the date of the order. Respondent No. 1/Defendant undertakes not to apply for registration of any trade marks similar or identical to Plaintiffs/Petitioners' trademark.

Amounts mentioned:

* Respondent No. 1/Defendant has already paid Rs. 1,25,000/- as token damages.
* If there is a default/breach by Respondent No. 1/Defendant, they will pay an additional sum of INR 25,00,000/- (Twenty Five Lakhs Only).

Source: PDF source: "Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr v. Rishabh Bansal.pdf".

nodes.title: Page 4
nodes.summary:
**Case:** Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr v. Rishabh Bansal (2023:DHC:2449)

**Proceedings:**

On page 4 of the PDF document, the court approves the settlement agreement between the parties. The key points are:

* The respondent (Rishabh Bansal) consents to a decree of perpetual injunction in favor of the plaintiffs.
* The parties confirm and verify the terms and conditions of the settlement agreement without any pressure or undue influence.
* They agree to abide by the terms and conditions, including not disputing them in future.
* In case of breach of terms, both sides may move the court for contempt proceedings against each other.

**Court Decision:**

The court decrees the suit in terms of the settlement agreement, and the rectification petition is disposed of. The registry is directed to prepare a decree-sheet.

**Source:** 2023:DHC:2449 (Ashok Kumar Gupta & Anr v. Rishabh Bansal.pdf)
nodes.content:
Neutral Citation Number : 2023:DHC:2449 
C.O. (COMM.IPD-TM) 752/2022 & cont. matter 
Page 4 of 5 
 
herein above provided that such breach/default arises out of the 
act(s) which are directly within the power and control of the 
Respondent no. 1/Defendant; 
 
n.  
The Respondent no. 1/Defendant has no objection if a 
decree of perpetual injunction is passed by this Hon'ble Court in 
favour of the plaintiffs according to the prayer clause of the 
paragraph 32 (a)&(b) of the plaint in CS (Comm.) No. 48 of 2023 
along with terms and conditions of the present settlement. 
 
o.  
The parties have gone through the terms and conditions 
herein and confirm and verify the same to be correct and that they 
put their signatures hereunder without any threat, coercion, 
pressure, or undue influence from any quarter and both sides agree 
to abide by the terms and conditions herein. 
 
p.  
The Parties have gone through this present Settlement 
Agreement and have understood the same and have no objections 
to the present terms and conditions. The parties also understand 
that bleach of the terms and conditions of this Settlement 
Agreement shall invite lawful action for contempt of court against 
them by the other party in the concerned Court 
 
q.  
That the Parties undertake before the Hon'ble Court to 
abide by the terms and conditions set out in the agreement and not 
to dispute the same hereinafter in future. 
 
r.  
The parties agree that they shall appear before the Hon'ble 
court during the hearing to make their statements in terms of the 
present settlement agreement.” 
 
2. 
Learned Counsel are present on behalf of their respective 
parties.  They undertake to abide by the aforesaid terms of settlement. 
 
3. 
As such, nothing survives for adjudication in the suit as well as 
the rectification petition.  Rectification petition stands disposed of and 
the suit stands decreed in terms of the aforesaid Settlement Agreement 
executed between the parties to which they shall remain bound. 
 
4. 
Let a decree-sheet be drawn up by the Registry.  
 
5. 
The plaintiffs would be entitled to refund of court fee, if any, 
Digitally Signed
By:SUNIL SINGH NEGI
Signing Date:11.04.2023
15:25:22
Signature Not Verified
